title: Tottenham news: Mauricio Pochettino admits Spurs have 'lost confidence'
text:
Mauricio Pochettino has admitted that Tottenham are struggling for confidence after being hammered by Bayern Munich and beaten by Brighton.

The Spurs boss, who was talking at the Aspire Global Summit in Qatar, has overseen just one win in six games and also saw his side dumped out of the Carabao Cup by League One Colchester last month.

However, Pochettino insists that there is no point laying into his players and telling them they are 's***' as it will do nothing to help them turn their poor form around.

Mauricio Pochettino opened up on Tottenham's struggles during a speech in Qatar on Monday

During a speech on Monday, Pochettino said: 'The team has lost confidence after two goals against.

'We have to work to win that trust again. We talk to the players. We tell them that we have lost by mistakes, but we must try to forget them.

'The best way to help the player is not telling him that he has done s***. You can't hide. You have to share the responsibility.

'We at Tottenham work as a team. After two big defeats like the ones we have suffered, we have to think about the future.

Tottenham's players react after conceding during Saturday's 3-0 defeat away at Brighton

'You have to recover the emotional level. When you are on the top, you feel you must respond to dignity.

'Football is born in the heart. Our responsibility is to be guardians of this, make sure you don't forget.

'You have to help the players to motivate themselves. But how can you motivate yourself after the Champions League? I say: "Are we professionals? Or not?"'

Pochettino is spending two days in Qatar during the international break before returning to training on Thursday.
description: Mauricio Pochettino has admitted that Tottenham are struggling for confidence after being hammered by Bayern Munich and beaten by Brighton.
